explanation: The report is correct. Given the provided macro definition LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0), the initialization int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg); always yields the constant 0. The subsequent controlling expression if (err) is therefore an invariant false expression (the branch is never taken). This is not one of the permitted exceptions to MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 (it is not an intentional infinite loop nor the allowed do-while constant case). Hence the code as presented violates Rule 14.3. (If in other build configurations LFS_LOCK expands to a non-constant function call, the invariant would not hold; MISRA analysis is performed on the translation unit after preprocessing, and with the given macro the violation stands.)
